org.jdom2.xpath
Class XPathFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.jdom2.xpath.XPathFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
JaxenXPathFactory
public abstract class XPathFactory
extends java.lang.Object

XPathFactory allows JDOM users to configure which XPath implementation to use when evaluating XPath expressions.

JDOM does not extend the core Java XPath API (javax.xml.xpath.XPath). Instead it creates a new API that is more JDOM and Java friendly leading to neater and more understandable code (in a JDOM context).

A JDOM XPathFactory instance is able to create JDOM XPath instances that can be used to evaluate XPath expressions against JDOM Content.

The XPathFactory allows either default or custom XPathFactory instances to be created. If you use the newInstance(String) method then an XPathFactory of that specific type will be created. If you use the newInstance() method then a default XPathFactory instance will be created.

XPathFactory instances are not specified to be thread-safe. You must ensure that each XPathFactory instances are appropriately protected from concurrent access. If you are using the default mechanisms for accessing XPath instances then you can use JDOM 1.x compatible XPath.newInstance(String) method to create XPath instances as that method is able to operate concurrently and efficiently.

Author:
Rolf Lear

XPathFactory

public XPathFactory()
Method Detail

newInstance

public static final XPathFactory newInstance()
                                      throws JDOMException
Create an instance of an XPathFactory using the default mechanisms to determine what XPathFactory implementation to use.

The default mechanism will inspect the system property org.jdom2.xpath.XPathFactory to determine what class should be used for the XPathFactory. If that property is not set then JDOM will use the JaxenXPathFactory.

Returns:
a new instance of the default XPathFactory
Throws:
JDOMException - if there is a problem creating a new instance.

newInstance

public static final XPathFactory newInstance(java.lang.String factoryclass)
                                      throws JDOMException
Create a specific instance of an XPathFactory.

Parameters:
factoryclass - The name of the XPathFactory class to create.
Returns:
An XPathFactory of the specifiec class.
Throws:
JDOMException - if there was a problem loading that XPath factory.

compile

public abstract XPath compile(java.lang.String xpath)
                       throws JDOMException
Create a concrete XPath instance from this factory. You can set Namespace and Variable lookups on the returned instance.

Parameters:
xpath - The expression to use for the XPath.
Returns:
an XPath instance.
Throws:
JDOMException - if there is a problem compiling the expression
